page.title: 19Transport in mid-Norfolk
page.content: Like many areas of Norfolk,Salhouse and its neighbouring villages suffer from poor public transport facilities. {Salhouse Station}is a victim of cuts on the railways and,although one or two pay trains stop during the day,on their way from Norwich to Cromer on the coast,the station buildings are falling into decay. Bus services appear to be even more infrequent,with local people who were interviewed,complaining that there are just 2 buses a day into and out of Norwich.There are also only 2 bus stops in Salhouse.With local people so dependent upon Norwich and its outskirts for many facilities,the car is a necessity rather than a luxury. Small wonder that Norfolk has one of the highest car owner per head of population figures in Gt.Britain.
